meanings.definition: A solemn procession, especially for a funeral.
meanings.sent1: The cortege slowly made its way to the cemetery, with mourners following behind.
meanings.sent2: The cortege of cars drove slowly through the town, paying respects to the deceased.
meanings.sent3: The cortege took a wrong turn and ended up at the ice cream shop instead of the graveyard.
meanings.sent4: The cortege of clouds moved across the sky, casting shadows over the land.
meanings.sent5: The cortege of ants marched in a straight line, carrying food back to their nest.

meanings.definition: A group of attendants accompanying an important person.
meanings.sent1: The royal cortege followed the king, dressed in their finest attire.
meanings.sent2: The presidential cortege arrived at the summit, surrounded by security personnel.
meanings.sent3: The cortege of ducks waddled behind the mother duck, quacking happily.
meanings.sent4: The cortege of stars twinkled in the night sky, guiding travelers on their journey.
meanings.sent5: The cortege of books lined the shelves, waiting to be read by eager minds.

meanings.definition: A sequence or series of events.
meanings.sent1: The cortege of disasters seemed to follow him wherever he went.
meanings.sent2: The cortege of celebrations marked the beginning of a new era.
meanings.sent3: The cortege of mishaps turned his day into a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: The cortege of memories flooded back as he walked through the old neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The cortege of seasons changed the landscape from green to gold.
